item.title: Missing manhole cover, 10th August
item.description:
Manhole cover missing in the empty house 76 Lensbury way in the garden. This has been filled up with rubbish which is now causing blocked drains for the other residents, also a child could fall down the drain as no manhole cover is present and the garden has no fence!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lensbury Way, London

item.title: Circa 19 tree shoots trip hazard, 10th August
item.description:
Some weeks back there was a tree here which was cut to ground level. The work was not done properly. There was a 2 foot mound, extending three or 4 m outside Number 41. As you can clearly see from the photographs the route was not dealt with in anyway and is now pushing through the tarmac that the work was covered with on the second attempt to solve the problem. This is urgent as it is causing a real problem to pedestrians, particularly mothers with prams, people with disabilities and those providing services to the area. It is also a hazard to children as well as the elderly who may not pay as much attention or be able to see the street in front of them. To bypass it safely one needs to go into the road and face the danger of traffic. Thank you for your prompt attention to this very serious matter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpelier Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on pavement, 10th August
item.description:
Food rubbish around bin in torn open bags. Fridge/freezer shelves. Big box of metal, could be a bed. Heavy gates to flats above the barbers always open onto path for people with limited vision to walk into. Could cross the road but stuff on the pavement from the shop. Please help. This is on the corner of Wythfield Road and Eltham High Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wythfield Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on Red Barracks Road, 10th August
item.description:
Never ending rubbish which splurges onto the pavement. Attracts Foxes, and Mice have also been seen. This is constant. They may like living in squalor some of us don’t . 4 Red Barracks Road. How are they being allowed to get away with this? Pure rotten.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Barracks Road, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet
